content.question: From the narrator’s perspective, Reena’s power to disturb arises in part from the complex and conflicting feelings brought about by

choices.label: Reena’s enthusiastic admiration of the narrator’s looks
Reena’s refusal to play with the narrator when they were children
the narrator’s suspicion that Aunt Vi favored Reena over her
the narrator’s sense of their shared identity as Black women in America

content.answer: the narrator’s sense of their shared identity as Black women in America

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the function of conflict in a text.
